author: J.D. Salinger
review: Holden Caulfield's narrative is a raw, unfiltered glimpse into the mind of a troubled adolescent. Salinger's portrayal of teenage angst and alienation is timeless.

author: Paulo Coelho
review: Coelho's allegorical tale of self-discovery and destiny follows Santiago, a young shepherd, on his journey to find his Personal Legend. The novel's timeless wisdom on following one's dreams has inspired millions around the world.

author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
review: Fitzgerald's magnum opus captures the essence of the Roaring Twenties with its lavish parties and complex characters. The novel's themes of love, wealth, and the American Dream resonate through the ages.

author: Harper Lee
review: Lee's Pulitzer Prize-winning novel confronts issues of racial injustice and moral growth through the eyes of a young girl in the American South. Its timeless lessons on empathy and compassion make it a must-read for all.

author: J.R.R. Tolkien
review: Tolkien's enchanting tale of adventure and heroism in Middle-earth captivates readers of all ages. Bilbo Baggins' journey from the comfort of his hobbit hole to the heart of dragon-infested lands is a timeless classic.

author: Jane Austen
review: Austen's timeless novel of manners and romance continues to enchant readers with its wit and charm. The spirited Elizabeth Bennet and the proud Mr. Darcy navigate societal expectations and their own prejudices in this classic love story.
